newsitem.title: USA: US Airways settles 5 crash suits--lawyer.
newsitem.headline: US Airways settles 5 crash suits--lawyer.

text.p: US Airways Group Inc and lawyers for five plaintiffs announced Wednesday a settlement of lawsuits resulting from the 1994 crash of a USAir jet outside Charlotte N.C., the plaintiffs' lawyer said.

Attorney David Rapoport said he had settled with US Airways in lawsuits over the deaths of Freddie Sue Sturkie and three other people killed when Flight 1016 went down in a violent thunderstorm on July 2, 1994.
Also settled was a suit brought by a survivor of the crash, in which 37 people died.
Rapoport said the two sides had agreed not to discuss terms of the settlement.

He said the Sturkie case, one of two that had been set for trial today, was a "seven-figure settlement." But he then backed away from that statement, saying only that the five settlements together totalled "in the millions."
Rapoport said the settlements were substantially higher as a result of a federal jury verdict Friday in which US Airways was found at fault in the crash.
A lawyer representing US Airways had no comment on the settlements.
